Public NotInheritable Class OracleBFile Inherits Stream Implements ICloneable, INullable
public ref class OracleBFile sealed : System::IO::Stream, ICloneable, System::Data::SqlTypes::INullable

summary.span: 表示托管 对象，该对象的设计旨在与 Oracle 数据类型配合使用。

span.span: Represents a managed object designed to work with the Oracle data type.

summary.span: 此类不能被继承。

span.span: This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Oracle`BFILE`数据类型是一种 Oracle`LOB`数据类型，包含最大大小为 4 千兆字节的二进制数据的引用。The Oracle `BFILE` data type is an Oracle `LOB` data type that contains a reference to binary data with a maximum size of 4 gigabytes. Oracle`BFILE`不同于其他 Oracle`LOB`数据类型，因为其数据存储在服务器上的物理文件中而不是操作系统。An Oracle `BFILE` differs from other Oracle `LOB` data types in that its data is stored in a physical file in the operating system instead of on the server. 请注意，`BFILE`数据类型提供对数据的只读访问。Note that the `BFILE` data type provides read-only access to data. 因此，面向写的方法继承自不支持类。Therefore, write-oriented methods inherited from the class are not supported. 其他特征`BFILE`将它从区分开来的数据类型`LOB`数据类型是：Other characteristics of a `BFILE` data type that distinguish it from a `LOB` data type are that it: - 包含非结构化数据。Contains unstructured data. - 支持服务器端分块。Supports server-side chunking. - 使用引用复制语义。Uses reference copy semantics. 例如，如果在执行复制操作`BFILE`，则只`BFILE`复制定位符 （这是对文件的引用）。For example, if you perform a copy operation on a `BFILE`, only the `BFILE` locator (which is a reference to the file) is copied. 而不会复制文件中的数据。The data in the file is not copied. `BFILE`数据类型应该用于引用`LOB`s 较大的大小，因此，在数据库中存储不可行。The `BFILE` data type should be used for referencing `LOB`s that are large in size, and therefore, not practical to store in the database. 没有使用的客户端、 服务器和通信开销`BFILE`数据类型相比`LOB`数据类型。There is client, server, and communication overhead for using a `BFILE` data type compared to the `LOB` data type. 它会更加高效访问`BFILE`如果你只需以获取少量的数据。It is more efficient to access a `BFILE` if you only need to obtain a small amount of data. 访问驻留在数据库中的更高效`LOB`s 如果你需要获取整个对象。It is more efficient to access database-resident `LOB`s if you need to obtain the entire object. 每个非 NULL对象都与两个定义基础物理文件的位置的实体关联：Each non-NULL object is associated with two entities that define the location of the underlying physical file: - 一个 Oracle DIRECTORY 对象，它是文件系统中一个目录的数据库别名，以及An Oracle DIRECTORY object, which is a database alias for a directory in the file system, and - 基础物理文件的文件名，它位于与 DIRECTORY 对象关联的目录中。The file name of the underlying physical file, which is located in the directory associated with the DIRECTORY object. 后`BFILE`是创建，你可以检索其定位符形式对象使用或方法。After a `BFILE` is created, you can retrieve its locator in the form of an object using the or methods. 若要获取对象，请调用方法。To obtain an object, call the method. 物理文件对象所关联与不需要存在，直到你尝试访问它。The physical file that an object is associated with does not need to exist until you attempt to access it. 应用程序可以将绑定到不存在的文件，在预期位置中，创建物理文件，然后调用。An application can bind an to a nonexistent file, create the physical file in the expected location, and then call . 任何尝试访问已关闭使用或方法重新打开自动流式传输。Any attempt to access a closed using the or methods reopens an stream automatically. 下面的 C# 示例演示如何创建`BFILE`在 Oracle 表，，然后检索它的形式对象。The following C# example demonstrates how you can create a `BFILE` in an Oracle table, and then retrieve it in the form of an object. 该示例演示如何使用对象和和方法。The example demonstrates the use of the object and the and methods. [!code-csharp[DataWorks OracleClient.BFile#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/DataWorks OracleClient.BFile/CS/source.cs#1)] 有关详细信息，有关创建和使用 Oracle `BFILE`，请参阅 Oracle 文档中的相应主题。For more information about creating and using an Oracle `BFILE`, see the appropriate topic in your Oracle documentation. > [!NOTE] > `BeginWrite`， `EndWrite`，和`WriteByte`方法，继承自`System.IO.Stream`类中，不支持，因为`BFILE`数据类型是只读的。The `BeginWrite`, `EndWrite`, and `WriteByte` methods, which are inherited from the `System.IO.Stream` class, are not supported because the `BFILE` data type is read-only.

summary.span: 创建此 对象的副本，该副本所关联的物理文件与原始对象所关联的相同。

span.span: Creates a copy of this object associated with the same physical file as the original.

returns.span: 一个新 对象，该对象所关联的物理文件与原始 对象所关联的相同。

span.span: A new object associated with the same physical file as the original object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 新属性对象最初具有与原始对象相同的值。The properties of the new object initially have the same values as those of the original object. 但是之后,已完成，每个对象是相互独立。However, after the is complete, each object is independent from the other. 例如，更改的值原始属性不会更改的值的副本。For example, changing the value of the property on the original does not change the value of on the copy.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 基础数据源类型的和目标必须兼容。The underlying data types of the source and the destination must be compatible. 例如，不能将二进制数据复制到目标，其字符数据类型。For example, you cannot copy binary data to a destination that has a character data type. 你必须具有写入访问权限目标为操作才能正确执行。You must have write access to the destination for the operation to execute correctly.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果你想要执行的比较运算上可以确定可为 null。 can be useful when you want to perform a comparison operation on an to determine nullability. 任何试图在上执行读取的操作对象成功，但不返回任何数据。Any attempt to perform a read operation on a object succeeds, but does not return any data. 任何试图在上执行写入操作对象生成异常。Any attempt to perform a write operation on a object generates an exception. 选择`BFILE`包含一个 null 值的列返回。Selecting a `BFILE` column that contains a null value returns .

summary.span: 获取 流中的当前读取位置。

span.span: Gets the current read position in the stream.
The current position within the stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 不支持查找到流的长度超出任何位置。Seeking to any location beyond the length of the stream is not supported. `Position`属性不会不跟踪的从和 / 或已用完，跳过，流的字节数。The `Position` property does not keep track of the number of bytes from the stream that have been consumed, skipped, or both.

exception.span: 尝试用一个负值或大于该流长度的值设置位置。

span.span: Attempted to set a position with a negative value or greater than the length of the stream.

exception.span: 关闭或释放该流后，调用方法。

span.span: Methods were called after the stream was closed or disposed.

public: override int Read(cli::array <System::Byte> ^ buffer, int offset, int count);

param.name: buffer
param.span: 字节数组。

span.span: An array of bytes.

param.span: 此方法返回时，该缓冲区包含指定的字节数组，该数组的 offset 和 (offset + count) 之间的值由从当前源中读取的字节替换。

span.span: When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.

param.name: offset
param.span: buffer 中从零开始的字节偏移量，从此处开始存储从当前流中读取的数据。

span.span: The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.

param.name: count
param.span: 要从当前流中最多读取的字节数。

span.span: The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.

summary.span: 从当前 流中读取字节序列，并在该流中按照读取的字节数提升位置。

span.span: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.

returns.span: 读入缓冲区中的总字节数。

span.span: The total number of bytes read into the buffer.

returns.span: 如果当前可用的字节数没有那么多，则总字节数可能小于请求的字节数，或者如果已到达文件的末尾，则为零。

span.span: This may be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero if the end of the file has been reached.

exception.span: 和 的总和大于缓冲区长度。

span.span: The sum of and is larger than the buffer length.

public: override long Seek(long offset, System::IO::SeekOrigin origin);

param.name: offset
param.span: 相对于 origin 的字节偏移量。

span.span: A byte offset relative to origin.

param.span: 如果 offset 为负，则新位置将位于 origin 指定的位置之前 offset 指定的字节数。

span.span: If offset is negative, the new position will precede the position specified by origin by the number of bytes specified by offset.

param.span: 如果 offset 为零，则新位置将是 origin 指定的位置。

span.span: If offset is zero, the new position will be the position specified by origin.

param.span: 如果 offset 为正，则新位置将位于 origin 指定的位置之后 offset 指定的字节数。

span.span: If offset is positive, the new position will follow the position specified by origin by the number of bytes specified by offset.

param.name: origin
param.span: 类型的值，指示用于获取新位置的参考点。

span.span: A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性读取整个`BFILE`一次。The property reads the entire `BFILE` at one time. > [!NOTE] > 使用的优点`BFILE`s 是能够检索大量在客户端的小区块中的数据。A benefit of using `BFILE`s is the ability to retrieve large amounts of data in chunks at the client. 但是，当使用，作为一个连续的区块，这可以显著提高应用程序开销获取 BFILE 列的所有数据。However, when you use , you obtain all the data for the BFILE column as one contiguous chunk, which can significantly increase application overhead.
